decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Works for the demolition of these buildings or any part thereof shall not be commenced before a valid construction contract, under which one of the parties is obliged to carry out and itself complete the works of redevelopment of the site for which planning permission was granted simultaneously with this consent, has been entered into and evidence of such construction has first been submitted to and formally accepted in writing by the planning authority.  REASON: To prevent premature demolition and the creation of a cleared site which would be harmful to the visual amenity of the are and adversely affect its character, in accordance with Adopted and Replacement UDP Policies B24 and 4.8. | No works authorised by this consent shall take place until the applicant has implemented a programme of building recording and analysis by a person or body approved by the Council. This programme shall be in accordance with a written scheme that has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the Council.  Precautions shall be taken to secure and protect the retained architectural features against accidental loss or damage during the demolition and building work. Before any demolition works are commenced, structural engineers drawings and a method statement indicating the proposed method of ensuring the safety and stability of the retained building fabric throughout the period of demolition and reconstruction, shall be submitted and approved by the Council. The relevant work shall be carried out in accordance with the structural engineer's drawings and the approved method statement.  Before works commence on site, a schedule of features to be carefully removed under the supervision of a person or body specialising in this procedure, appointed by the applicant and approved by the Council, shall be agreed. These features are to be stored under cover in a secure place until their relocation and a timetable for this has been agreed with the Council. Written confirmation should be given to the Council immediately following this work of the items removed and their new location.  REASON: To protect the building and its fixtures and fittings of the locally listed building in the conservation area during the period of alterations in accordance with Adopted and replacement UDP policies B21, B22, B24, and 4.7, 4.8.
description: Demolition of substantially whole of existing cinema, but retaining front fatade, in association with alterations and extensions to front fatade, redevelopment of cinema site and adjacent car park to provide sixteen-screen cinema and ancillary uses including cafeteria/catering, public exhibition, confectionery and toilet areas with screens on two levels, and additional mezzanine levels in a building equivalent to a 4 storey building, plus basement and roof-top plant, servicing turntable with vehicular access from New Broadway, and associated improvements to Barnes Pikle and forecourt pavement area  (Conservation Area Consent)
